dublinCore.dc:title: 116 HR 1969 : No Wrong Door for Veterans Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend and reauthorize the Staff Sergeant Parker Gordon Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program of the Department of Veterans Affairs.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Wrong Door for Veterans Act.

section.header: Reauthorization and improvement of Staff Sergeant Parker Gordon Fox Suicide Prevention Grant Program of Department of Veterans Affairs

subsection.text: Section 201 of the Commander John Scott Hannon Veterans Mental Health Care Improvement Act of 2019 (Public Law 116–171; 38 U.S.C. 1720F note) is amended, in subsection (j), by striking the date that is three years after the date on which the first grant is awarded under this section and inserting September 30, 2026.

subparagraph.text: by inserting after paragraph (2) the following new paragraph (3):

paragraph.text: In the case of an eligible individual who receives suicide prevention services provided or coordinated by an eligible entity in receipt of a grant under this section, the eligible entity shall notify—

subparagraph.text: the eligible individual that the individual may be eligible for emergent suicide care under section 1720J of title 38, United States Code; and
the Secretary, if an eligible individual notified under subparagraph (A) elects to receive such emergent suicide care.
in paragraph (4), as so redesignated, by striking (1) or (2) and inserting (1), (2), or (3); and
by inserting (1) In general.— before When and adjusting the margins accordingly; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.text: If the Secretary does not provide services under paragraph (1) to an eligible individual during the 72-hour period following a referral under subsection (m), such eligible individual shall be treated as eligible for emergent suicide care under section 1720J of title 38, United States Code.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (p)—

paragraph.text: by striking section a total of $174,000,000 for fiscal years 2021 through 2025. and inserting section—; and
by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:
a total of $174,000,000 for fiscal years 2021 through 2025; and

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (q)(3)—

paragraph.text: by inserting an entity that has continuously provided mental health care or support services in the United States during the two-year period before the date on which the entity applies for a grant under this section and that is after means;
in subparagraph (A), by striking or foundation and inserting , foundation, or health care provider; and
in subparagraph (E), by striking A and inserting a.

subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (q)(5), by striking Medical services and inserting The term emergency treatment means medical services.

subsection.header: Required use of certain screening protocol
subsection.text: Such section is further amended, in subsection (q)(11)(A)(ii), by inserting after risk the following: , which in the case of a grant made on or after the date of the enactment of the No Wrong Door for Veterans Act, shall be the Columbia Protocol (also known as the Columbia-Suicide Severity Rating Scale).

section.header: Inclusion of adaptive prostheses and terminal devices for sports and other recreational activities in medical services furnished to eligible veterans by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs
section.text: Section 1701 of title 38, United States Code, is amended, in paragraph (6)(F)(i), by inserting (including adaptive prostheses and terminal devices for sports and other recreational activities) after artificial limbs.

section.header: Extension of certain limits on payments of pension
section.text: Section 5503(d)(7) of title 38, United States Code, is amended by striking November 30, 2031 and inserting January 30, 2033.

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives May 22 (legislative day May 21), 2025.
